column1: what are the seven wonders of the world
column2: The Great Wall of China, The Taj Mahal, Petra, The Colosseum, Christ the Redeemer, Chichen Itza, Machu Picchu

column1: how many wonders of the world are there
column2: There are seven wonders of the world

column1: what are the original seven wonders of the world
column2: The Great Pyramid of Giza, The Hanging Gardens of Babylon, The Statue of Zues at Olympia, The Temple of Artemis at Ephesus, The Mauloseum at Halicarnasses, The Colossus of Rhodes, The Lighthouse of Alexandria

column1: what are the seven natural wonders of the world
column2: Paricutin Volcano Mexico, Victoria Falls, Mount Evarest, The Great Barrier Reef, The Grand Canyon, Harbor of Rio deJaneiro, Aurora Borealis( Northern lights)

column1: how many of the original seven wonders still exists
column2: The only ancient wonder that has survived to this day is the Great Pyramid of Giza. The other six are in ruins or have vanished altogether.

column1: where is the Great wall of China
column2: The Great Wall of China is in the China. Fun fact: the  great wall of China is the longest wall in the world.
The Taj Mahal is in India
Petra is an ancient city in Jordan that was carved into Rock

column1: what was the Collosseum used for
column2: The Colosseum in Italy was used for Gladiator fights.

column1: Tell me about Christ the Redeemer
column2: Christ the Redeemer is a statue located at the summit of Corcovado Mountain overlooking Rio de Janeiro in Brazil. The statue shows Jesus Christ with his arms spread out over the city. The statue is 30 metres tall, with an arm span of the statue is 28 metres! The structure is the newest wonder, having been completed in 1931
